creator: ville.skytta@iki.fi
text:
Doing a ./build.sh main_distribution fails with the message 
... 
internal_dist: 
Created dir: /home/scop/cvs/jakarta-ant/jakarta-ant-1.6alpha/etc 
Copying 2 files to /home/scop/cvs/jakarta-ant/jakarta-ant-1.6alpha/lib 
Copying 1 file to /home/scop/cvs/jakarta-ant/jakarta-ant-1.6alpha/lib 
Copying 179 files to /home/scop/cvs/jakarta-ant/jakarta-ant-1.6alpha/docs 
Copying 7 files to /home/scop/cvs/jakarta-ant/jakarta-ant-1.6alpha/docs 
Copying 5 files to /home/scop/cvs/jakarta-ant/jakarta-ant-1.6alpha 
 
BUILD FAILED 
/home/scop/cvs/jakarta-ant/build.xml:785: chmod returned: -1 
 
Total time: 19 seconds 
 
The lines that cause this in build.xml are: 
    <chmod perm="ugo+r" dir="${dist.dir}" type="file" includes="**" 
           failonerror="${chmod.fail}" /> 
 
Changing failonerror to false "fixes" this.  My Ant is from CVS HEAD as of today.
Are you the owner of the files - i.e. can you "chmod them" on the command line?
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
Yes, I can. Here's some tracing:   
  
[scop@bobcat jakarta-ant]$ ./build.sh main_distribution   
[...]   
BUILD FAILED  
/home/scop/cvs/jakarta-ant/build.xml:785: chmod returned: -1  
  
Total time: 19 seconds  
[scop@bobcat jakarta-ant]$ for file in `find -type f`; do chmod ugo+r $file || echo "chmod 
failed with $file"; done 
[scop@bobcat jakarta-ant]$ echo $? 
0 
[scop@bobcat jakarta-ant]$
creator: ville.skytta@iki.fi
ville.skytta@iki.fi
text:
Ahem, doing a bootstrap from a clean environment fixed this.  I'll close this one with 
WORKSFORME, sorry about the noise.
